items.title: Sanchez now facing felony charge for altercation
items.summary: Mark Sanchez is facing a felony battery charge over the altercation between the former NFL quarterback and a 69-year-old truck driver early Saturday in Indianapolis.

items.title: 👀 Saints' petty Dart jab leads Week 5 NFL trolls
items.summary: The trolls were in full force during Week 5 of the NFL season, led by the New Orleans Saints poking fun at New York Giants rookie Jaxson Dart.

items.title: Questions, takeaways from every NFL Week 5 game: Jaguars outlast Chiefs; Bucs and Titans win thrillers
items.summary: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 5.

items.title: Colts work out two DBs to potentially improve depleted secondary depth
items.summary: On Monday, the Indianapolis Colts worked out cornerbacks Lewis Cine and Kendall Fuller to potentially bolster the depth of an increasingly depleted secondary (via KPRC2’s Aaron Wilson): At cornerback, having already lost rookie Justin Walley for the season and placed Jaylon Jones on injured reserve to begin the 2025 campaign, the Colts have since seen […]

items.title: The Cardinals really lost? The Eagles and Rams, too? Barnwell on three embarrassing Week 5 letdowns
items.summary: We saw blown leads, bad turnovers, tough calls and one of the weirdest TDs you'll see all season. Let's stack three head-scratching losses from NFL Week 5.

items.title: A Travis Hunter on every NFL team? 32 players who could be two-way threats
items.summary: The Jaguars rookie plays both wide receiver and cornerback. We found other versatile players across the league.

items.title: 5 Colts Things: Where offense ranks in NFL through Week 5, Daniel Jones dissects Raiders' defense, inside Segun Olubi's blocked punt
items.summary: The Colts, after beating the Las Vegas Raiders by 34 points on Sunday, are tied with the Buffalo Bills for the best record in the AFC at 4-1.

items.title: Colts could consider recently resurfaced former Bengals veteran linebacker again
items.summary: According to NFL Network’s Ian Rapoport, the Las Vegas Raiders are releasing veteran linebacker Germaine Pratt, who did not travel with the team to Indianapolis this past weekend for ‘non-injury’ reasons: The 29-year-old veteran linebacker made 4 prior starts for the Raiders defense this season, recording 25 tackles (10 solo) and 2 passes defensed. Per […]

items.title: 'As gritty as they come:' How Ashton Dulin's mindset and preparation paid off for Colts in win over Raiders
items.summary: Dulin played 47 of the Colts' 66 offensive snaps in their 40-6 win over the Raiders on Sunday.

items.title: Colts kicker Spencer Shrader out for remainder of 2025 season
items.summary: Head coach Shane Steichen said the Colts will work out a handful of kickers ahead of Wednesday's first practice of Week 6.

items.title: Report: Colts lose impressive starting PK Spencer Shrader for season
items.summary: According to Pat McAfee of ‘The Pat McAfee Show,’ impressive Indianapolis Colts kicker Spencer Shrader has suffered a season-ending right kicking knee injury during Sunday’s blowout win against the Las Vegas Raiders: After speaking with him, McAfee believes Shrader ‘tore multiple ligaments’ but was in good spirits. ‘Pro Football Doc’ David J. Chao earlier speculated […]

items.title: Colts’ 40-6 win over Raiders was reminiscent of days of old
items.summary: For years, many Sundays in Colts country could be rather sleepy. Of course there were monster games on the schedule and huge showdowns in prime time, but when Peyton Manning and company went to work in the one p.m. time-slot, it could be a real snoozer. Don’t get me wrong, beating the snot out of […]

items.title: Colts’ Shane Steichen after Spencer Shrader’s season-ending knee injury: ‘He was having a helluva season’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts’ worst fears have been realized. Kicker Spencer Shrader suffered a season-ending knee injury in Sunday’s 40-6 win over the Las Vegas Raiders, according to a source with knowledge of the situation. After the game, Coach Shane Steichen admitted, “It doesn’t look good.’’ Steichen confirmed Monday that Shrader tore the anterior [...]

items.title: Colts’ early season success starting to feel real
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts are currently 4-1, sitting atop the AFC, and this season’s early success is starting to feel very much real. It’s not as though the Colts’ initial three wins were flukey by any means (although they did get admittedly a bit lucky on that late ‘leverage’ penalty against the Denver Broncos in Week […]

items.title: Colts’ Monday Morning Awards: Week 5 vs. Raiders
items.summary: 4-1, this is how good teams bounce back from a tough loss, and how elite teams play against mediocre opposition. When was the last time you saw the Colts consistently dominate playing against opponents that were considerably worse? As we prepare for two tough opponents coming up, the wind is definitely behind the Colts’ sails. […]

items.title: AFC Playoff Picture: Indianapolis Colts are on top after Week 5
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts are first place in the AFC. Who saw that coming!? After the Buffalo Bills lost on Sunday Night Football to end their undefeated season, the Colts swapped places with them for the top spot in the conference. AFC South standings after Week 5 The Jacksonville Jaguars don’t play until Monday night, so […]

items.title: Colts-Cardinals opening odds: Bye Bye Birdie
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts don’t meet the Arizona Cardinals often but the last time they did, it was a memorable game with the Colts winning a thriller on Christmas night. The Colts are looking to make some more positive memories at the expense of the Cardinals as they host them in week six from Lucas Oil. […]

items.title: This is ‘The Colture’ that Colts GM Chris Ballard has Envisioned
items.summary: Indianapolis, IN — For years, Indianapolis Colts general manager Chris Ballard preached patience without following through with a worthwhile product. From the uncertainty that was the quarterback carousel post-Luck to the uninspiring free agent cycles of yesteryear were just two of this regime’s biggest shortcomings thus far, with many more deficiencies scattered throughout. Through five […]

items.title: Colts’ 40-6 blowout of Raiders included much more from Ashton Dulin
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Michael Pittman Jr. has been there for the past five-plus seasons as Ashton Dulin has done whatever he’s been told. Day after day. Week after week. Season after season. “He really busts his ass every single day,’’ Pittman said Sunday afternoon at Lucas Oil Stadium. “He’s giving effort. He does everything right. “He [...]

items.title: With 3 more touchdowns, Colts' Jonathan Taylor continues playing like the 'best back in the league'
items.summary: Jonathan Taylor's seven touchdowns in the first five games of the 2025 season tied a franchise record last reached by Marvin Harrison in 1999.

items.title: How a certain collective mentality produced Colts' biggest margin of victory in over a decade with Week 5 blowout win over Raiders
items.summary: The Colts' 40-6 win over the Las Vegas Raiders came on the heels of a frustrating Week 4 loss to the Los Angeles Rams – a defeat the Colts did not let linger in a negative way leading up to Sunday.

items.title: After win over Raiders, Colts react to Spencer Shrader's knee injury: 'Hate it for him'
items.summary: Shrader sustained a knee injury in the second quarter of the Colts' 40-6 win over the Raiders on Sunday.

items.title: Colts head coach has discouraging, yet limited injury update on kicker Spencer Shrader
items.summary: According to head coach Shane Steichen post-game, “it doesn’t look good” regarding now injured Indianapolis Colts place kicker Spencer Shrader (via 1075 The Fan’s Kevin Bowen): Shrader was injured with 7:56 left in the second quarter on an extra point attempt, when he was run over during his post-kicking motion, and roughing the kicker was […]

items.title: Colts dominate Raiders, 40-6, to improve to 4-1
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The Indianapolis Colts rebounded from their first loss of the season last week to beat the Las Vegas Raiders, 40-6, at Lucas Oil Stadium on Sunday afternoon to improve to 4-1. The Raiders jumped out to a 3-0 lead in the first quarter, but the Colts took total control of the game from [...]

items.title: Jonathan Taylor scores 3 touchdowns as Colts dismantle Raiders
items.summary: The Colts scored touchdowns on six consecutive possessions in the 40-6 win.

items.title: 'There's no Shaq Leonard without the Indianapolis Colts:' Former Colts linebacker Shaquille Leonard reflects on his career and legacy ahead of retirement
items.summary: Leonard, a three-time first-team AP All-Pro, will officially retire as a member of the Colts at halftime of the Colts' Week 5 game against the Las Vegas Raiders.

items.title: Sideline to Sideline: Celebrity Meeting
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - Every week Blue Zone's Chris Widlic asks the Colts one question about life off the field. Today Chris asks the players which celebrity they would most like to meet.

items.title: Keys to the Game: Colts vs. Raiders
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - The Colts look to get back to their winning ways after suffering their first loss of the season last week to the Rams. IndyStar Colts' insider Joel A. Erickson gives his keys to the team getting a victory over the Raiders this afternoon at Lucas Oil Stadium and improving to 4-1.

items.title: Colts announce 7 inactive players for Week 5 game vs. Las Vegas Raiders
items.summary: The Colts on Friday ruled out running back Tyler Goodson (groin), wide receiver Alec Pierce (concussion), cornerback Kenny Moore II (Achilles) and safety Daniel Scott (knee)

items.summary: TV broadcast, radio and streaming information for Las Vegas Raiders at Indianapolis Colts on Sunday, October 5 at 1:00 p.m. ET (Week 5).

items.title: Lucas Oil Stadium roof will be closed for Colts-Raiders game
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Lucas Oil Stadium's roof will be closed during Sunday's Colts-Raiders game. Indianapolis enters the matchup with a 3-1 record and is determined to notch another win in front of its home fans. Last week, the Colts lost against the Los Angeles Rams, while the Raiders (1-3) fell to the Bears.

items.summary: The Colts made the roster moves on Saturday.

items.title: Former Colts defensive tackle Arthur Jones dies
items.summary: Jones was 39 years old.

items.title: Former Colt Arthur Jones passes away
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Arthur Jones, who spent three of his seven NFL seasons with the Indianapolis Colts, passed away Friday. The Baltimore Ravens, who selected the personable defensive tackle in the fifth round of the 2010 draft, announced his passing on social media. Jones was 39. No details of his death have been released. “We are [...]

items.title: Colts rule out WR Alec Pierce; what will AD Mitchell’s role be?
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts again must adapt to not having Alec Pierce on the field. One of their offensive catalysts has been ruled out of Sunday’s meeting with the Las Vegas Raiders at Lucas Oil Stadium after experiencing a setback this week while working through the NFL’s concussion protocol. Pierce was a full participant [...]

items.summary: Cross currently leads the Colts with 34 tackles and is tied for first among all NFL safeties with two sacks.

items.summary: Leonard, a three-time first-team AP All-Pro, will retire as a member of the Colts at halftime of Sunday's Week 5 game against the Las Vegas Raiders at Lucas Oil Stadium.

items.title: Colts must determine who replaces retired Xavien Howard at CB (Mekhi Blackmon?)
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — If there was a personnel decision for Lou Anarumo to make at cornerback, Xavien Howard made it for him. The veteran cornerback, after a subpar game in Sunday’s loss at the Los Angeles Rams and four very un-Howard-like starts in his comeback with the Indianapolis Colts, decided to retire on Wednesday. The question [...]

items.summary: Latu totaled nine pressures in Week 4, the most by a Colts player in a single game in four years.

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 429: Colts Host Raiders; Howard's Sudden Retirement
items.summary: In this edition of the Colts Blue Zone Podcast, Dave Griffiths, Mike Chappell and Matt Adams preview Indy's upcoming game against the Las Vegas Raiders, a matchup featuring a pair of resurgent quarterbacks in Daniel Jones and Geno Smith. Plus: the sudden retirement of Xavien Howard, an honor for "The Maniac," injury updates and our [...]

items.title: Colts’ Spencer Shrader named AFC Special Teams Player of the Month
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – As the media surrounded Spencer Shrader’s cubicle Thursday afternoon, his long-snapper offered an appropriate backdrop. “There he is,’’ Luke Rhodes said. “Player of the Month.’’ Yes, AFC Special Teams Player of the Month for the Indianapolis Colts’ kicker. “It’s been a blessing,’’ Shrader said. “It’s been a lot of fun.’’ As it turned [...]

items.title: Colts K Spencer Shrader named AFC Special Teams Player of the Month for September
items.summary: In the month of September Shrader made 13 field goals and 12 extra points, scoring a total of 51 points.

items.title: Former Colts OL Chris Hinton among 52 Senior candidates for Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026
items.summary: Hinton, who is in the Colts' Ring of Honor, was a seven-time Pro Bowler and three-time All-Pro during his 13-year NFL career.

items.title: Hinton, Boyd, Curtis head Colts’ senior candidates for Pro Football Hall of Fame
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Four Colts, including three icons who touched two cities, are among 52 senior candidates who will be considered for the Pro Football Hall of Fame’s Class of 2026. Offensive lineman Chris Hinton, whose 13-year career began with decorated seasons in Baltimore and Indy, along with cornerback Bobby Boyd and linebacker Mike Curtis, both [...]

items.summary: The Colts made the roster move on Thursday.

items.title: Indianapolis Colts’ cornerback Xavien Howard retires
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Xavien Howard’s attempt to restart a decorated career lasted four games. The Indianapolis Colts placed the veteran cornerback on the reserve/retired list Wednesday. Howard didn’t practice earlier in the day because of a “personal matter.’’ That apparently was Howard determining he no longer possessed the required passion or was the player who had [...]

items.title: Colts must turn the page after loss at Rams
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – It’s the only way to navigate the NFL’s 17-game season: Turn the page. Review on Monday what took place the previous day – good and bad – make the necessary adjustments, then assume the necessary tunnel-vision approach for the next opponent. "You’re on to the next week pretty quickly," Daniel Jones said on [...]

items.title: Colts place CB Xavien Howard on Reserve/Retired list, sign S Trey Washington to 53-man roster from practice squad
items.summary: The Colts made the roster move on Wednesday.

items.title: Shane Steichen sees common thread between Raiders QB Geno Smith and Colts QB Daniel Jones
items.summary: Steichen was with Smith for one season with the Los Angeles Chargers, and even though he didn't start that year, the now-Colts head coach was impressed by his work ethic.

items.title: Practice Notebook: G Matt Goncalves, WR Alec Pierce return to practice after missing Week 4 game vs. Rams
items.summary: Goncalves (toe, limited) and Pierce (concussion, full) both participated in the Colts' first practice of Week 5 on Wednesday at the Indiana Farm Bureau Football Center.

items.title: Colts to honor Shaq Leonard at halftime as former linebacker announces retirement
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS -- "The Maniac" will have his moment. Shaquille Leonard, the dynamic linebacker drafted by Indianapolis in 2018, plans to retire as member of the Colts. The six-year veteran former All-Pro spent the bulk of his career with the Horseshoe. Injuries derailed his promising career. The team will honor him during Sunday's game against the [...]

items.title: Former All-Pro linebacker Shaquille Leonard to retire as member of Colts at halftime of Week 5 game vs. Las Vegas Raiders
items.summary: Leonard was a three-time first-team AP All-Pro and three-time Pro Bowler during six standout seasons with the Colts.

items.title: Blame for the Colts’ 10-man defense: Coordinator Lou Anarumo takes full responsibility
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – In this instance, the buck didn’t stop at the boss’s desk. The boss would be Shane Steichen. The Indianapolis Colts’ third-year head coach accepted the blame for his defense having only 10 players on the field when Matthew Stafford hooked up with Tutu Atwell for a game-winning 88-yard touchdown in Sunday’s 27-20 loss [...]
